categories.summary:
# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
Jin reported significant progress on porting Hyperfy v1 apps to a new platform, with an April deadline. They've successfully ported many commonly used apps including models, images, seats, spawns, text, grid, zone, audio, portal, video, VRM, sky, light, sun, fog, particles, platform, emote, free look, stream, screen, grabbable, NPC, car, camera, and launchpad. Jin shared statistics showing they've analyzed 1,982 archived worlds containing 44,653 total entities, with 85.3% (38,079) covered by the converter and 14.7% (6,574) not yet implemented. Jin created a GitHub repository (github.com/madjin/hyperfy-apps) to store the ported Hyperfy apps from Discord. Additionally, cru forked Hyperfy to create an agent simulation proof of concept (molt.space/view) where any agent can join the Hyperfy world.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What kind of testing help do you need? (asked by Valiant) A: Standard QA, report errors / behavior that deviates from v1 (answered by jin)
Q: Does the physics system work under the surface as well (diving & sea floor plants)? (asked by Fibelius) A: It doesn't (answered by Fibelius)
Q: Who should I contact for a partnership? (asked by AkR) A: Unanswered
Q: Are all these avatars available? (asked by Fibelius) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: jin | Helpee: Pete | Context: Pete wanted to test converted apps | Resolution: jin offered to help if Pete DM'd their address that owns worlds
Helper: BallisticBanana | Helpee: jin | Context: jin mentioned needing support with AI credits | Resolution: BallisticBanana offered to donate credits for jin's work

## 4. Action Items
Type: Technical | Description: Complete porting of remaining 14.7% (6,574) entities not yet implemented | Mentioned By: jin
Type: Technical | Description: Test ported Hyperfy v1 apps for errors/behavior deviations | Mentioned By: jin
Type: Documentation | Description: Document the ported Hyperfy apps in the GitHub repository | Mentioned By: jin
Type: Feature | Description: Agent simulation where any agent can join Hyperfy world | Mentioned By: cru

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only a single message from user SPOOK greeting someone named "ash" and asking them to check their direct messages. There is no technical discussion, problem-solving, or implementation details shared in this public channel segment.
